intro: Acmanthera fernandesii, commonly known as the Cape Verde nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the Cape Verde Islands. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades and tomatoes. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue, which bloom at night. Its leaves are oval-shaped with a slightly hairy texture, and it thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. Acmanthera fernandesii is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky habitats.
